noun.description: The truncated remnant of a pencil, cigarette, or similar-shaped object after use.
The part of a check, receipt, ticket, or other document torn off and kept as a record.

examples: I stubbed my toe, swore, and tripped

verb.description: Extinguish (a lighted cigarette) by pressing the lighted end against something.
examples: she stubbed out her cigarette in the overflowing ashtray

verb.description: Dig up (a plant) by the roots.

origin: Old English stub(b) stump of a tree, of Germanic origin. The verb is first recorded ( late Middle English) in sense 3; stub (sense 1 of the verb) (mid 19th century) was originally a US usage.
